node.name: bgp-rib
node.description: Top level container for BGP RIBsNone

node.name: afi-safis
node.description: Enclosing container for address family listNone

node.name: afi-safi
node.description: list of afi-safi typesNone

node.name: afi-safi-name
node.description: AFI,SAFINone

node.name: ipv4-unicast
node.description: Routing tables for IPv4 unicast -- active when the afi-safi name is ipv4-unicastNone

node.name: loc-rib
node.description: Main routing table on the router, containing best-path selections for each prefix. The loc-rib may contain multiple routes for the same prefix (it is a read-only, unkeyed list). The best-path leaf should be set to true for the route selected by the best-path selection process. Note that multiple paths may be used or advertised even if only one path is marked as best, e.g., when using BGP add-paths. An implementation may choose to mark multiple paths in the RIB as best path by setting the flag to true for multiple entries.None

node.name: num-routes
node.description: Number of route entries in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.name: prefix
node.description: Prefix for the routeNone

node.name: attributes
node.description: Base BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: origin
node.description: BGP attribute defining the origin of the path information.None

node.name: as-path
node.description:
String representation of the BGP AS path attribute as concatenated AS path segments. Each segment of the AS_PATH should be formatted as follows based on the segment type (#### denotes a single AS number):
AS_SEQ: #### #### ##### AS_SET: { #### #### } AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE: ( #### #### ) AS_CONFED_SET: [ #### #### ]
AS_PATH segment types are described in RFC 5065.
In the Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, this leaf should show the received or sent AS_PATH value, respectively. For example, if the local router is not 4-byte capable, this value should consist of 2-octet ASNs or the AS_TRANS (AS 23456) values received or sent in route updates.
In the Loc-RIB, this leaf should reflect the effective AS path for the route, e.g., a 4-octet value if the local router is 4-octet capable.None

node.name: as4-path
node.description: This string represents the AS path encoded with 4-octet AS numbers in the optional transitive AS4_PATH attribute. This value is populated with the received or sent attribute in Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, respectively. It should not be populated in Loc-RIB since the Loc-RIB is expected to store the effective AS-Path in the as-path leaf regardless of being 4-octet or 2-octet.None

node.name: next-hop
node.description: BGP next hop attribute defining the IP address of the router that should be used as the next hop to the destinationNone

node.name: med
node.description: BGP multi-exit discriminator attribute used in BGP route selection processNone

node.name: local-pref
node.description: BGP local preference attribute sent to internal peers to indicateNone

node.name: atomic-aggr
node.description: BGP attribute indicating that the prefix is an atomic aggregate, i.e., the peer selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route that is included in it.None

node.name: aggregator
node.description: BGP attribute indicating the prefix has been aggregated by the specified AS and router.None

node.name: as
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: as4
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation (4-octet representation). This value is populated if an upstream router is not 4-octet capable. Its semantics are similar to the AS4_PATH optional transitive attributeNone

node.name: address
node.description: IP address of the router that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: community
node.description: List of standard BGP community attributes.None

node.name: ext-attributes
node.description: Extended BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: originator-id
node.description: BGP attribute that provides the id as an IPv4 address of the route reflector that created the announcementNone

node.name: cluster-list
node.description: Represents the reflection path that the route has passed.None

node.name: ext-community
node.description: List of BGP extended community attributesNone

node.name: aigp
node.description: BGP path attribute representing the accumulated IGP metric for the pathNone

node.name: path-id
node.description: When the BGP speaker supports advertisement of multiple paths for a prefix, the path identifier is used to uniquely identify a route based on the combination of the prefix and path id. In the Adj-RIB-In, the path-id value is the value received in the update message. In the Loc-RIB, if used, it should represent a locally generated path-id value for the corresponding route. In Adj-RIB-Out, it should be the value sent to a neighbor when add-paths is used, i.e., the capability has been negotiated.None

node.name: unknown-attribute
node.description: This list contains received attributes that are unrecognized or unsupported by the local router. The list may be empty.None

node.name: attr-type
node.description: 2-octet value encoding the attribute flags and the attribute type codeNone

node.name: attr-len
node.description: One or two octet attribute length field indicating the length of the attribute data in octets. If the Extended Length attribute flag in the attribute type field is set, the length field is 2 octets, otherwise it is 1 octetNone

node.name: attr-value
node.description: Raw attribute value data, not to exceed the length indicated in the attr-len field. The maximum length of the attribute data is 2^16-1 per the max value of the attr-len field (2 octets).None

node.name: last-modified-date
node.description: Timestamp of when this path was last changedNone

node.name: last-update-received
node.description: Timestamp of when the last BGP update message was received for this path / prefixNone

node.name: valid-route
node.description: Indicates that the route is considered valid by the local routerNone

node.name: invalid-reason
node.description: If the route is rejected as invalid, this indicates the reason.None

node.name: best-path
node.description: Current path was selected as the best path.None

node.name: oc-bgprib-ext:reject-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason the route is not used, either due to policy filtering or bestpath selectionNone

node.name: neighbors
node.description: Enclosing container for neighbor listNone

node.name: neighbor
node.description: List of neighbors (peers) of the local BGP speakerNone

node.name: neighbor-address
node.description: IP address of the BGP neighbor or peerNone

node.name: adj-rib-in-pre
node.description: Per-neighbor table containing the NLRI updates received from the neighbor before any local input policy rules or filters have been applied. This can be considered the 'raw' updates from the neighbor.None

node.name: num-routes
node.description: Number of route entries in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.name: prefix
node.description: Prefix for the routeNone

node.name: attributes
node.description: Base BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: origin
node.description: BGP attribute defining the origin of the path information.None

node.name: as-path
node.description:
String representation of the BGP AS path attribute as concatenated AS path segments. Each segment of the AS_PATH should be formatted as follows based on the segment type (#### denotes a single AS number):
AS_SEQ: #### #### ##### AS_SET: { #### #### } AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE: ( #### #### ) AS_CONFED_SET: [ #### #### ]
AS_PATH segment types are described in RFC 5065.
In the Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, this leaf should show the received or sent AS_PATH value, respectively. For example, if the local router is not 4-byte capable, this value should consist of 2-octet ASNs or the AS_TRANS (AS 23456) values received or sent in route updates.
In the Loc-RIB, this leaf should reflect the effective AS path for the route, e.g., a 4-octet value if the local router is 4-octet capable.None

node.name: as4-path
node.description: This string represents the AS path encoded with 4-octet AS numbers in the optional transitive AS4_PATH attribute. This value is populated with the received or sent attribute in Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, respectively. It should not be populated in Loc-RIB since the Loc-RIB is expected to store the effective AS-Path in the as-path leaf regardless of being 4-octet or 2-octet.None

node.description: BGP next hop attribute defining the IP address of the router that should be used as the next hop to the destinationNone

node.description: BGP multi-exit discriminator attribute used in BGP route selection processNone

node.description: BGP local preference attribute sent to internal peers to indicateNone

node.description: BGP attribute indicating that the prefix is an atomic aggregate, i.e., the peer selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route that is included in it.None

node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation.None

node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation (4-octet representation). This value is populated if an upstream router is not 4-octet capable. Its semantics are similar to the AS4_PATH optional transitive attributeNone

node.name: address
node.description: IP address of the router that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: community
node.description: List of standard BGP community attributes.None

node.name: ext-attributes
node.description: Extended BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: originator-id
node.description: BGP attribute that provides the id as an IPv4 address of the route reflector that created the announcementNone

node.name: cluster-list
node.description: Represents the reflection path that the route has passed.None

node.name: ext-community
node.description: List of BGP extended community attributesNone

node.name: aigp
node.description: BGP path attribute representing the accumulated IGP metric for the pathNone

node.name: path-id
node.description: When the BGP speaker supports advertisement of multiple paths for a prefix, the path identifier is used to uniquely identify a route based on the combination of the prefix and path id. In the Adj-RIB-In, the path-id value is the value received in the update message. In the Loc-RIB, if used, it should represent a locally generated path-id value for the corresponding route. In Adj-RIB-Out, it should be the value sent to a neighbor when add-paths is used, i.e., the capability has been negotiated.None

node.name: unknown-attribute
node.description: This list contains received attributes that are unrecognized or unsupported by the local router. The list may be empty.None

node.name: attr-type
node.description: 2-octet value encoding the attribute flags and the attribute type codeNone

node.name: attr-len
node.description: One or two octet attribute length field indicating the length of the attribute data in octets. If the Extended Length attribute flag in the attribute type field is set, the length field is 2 octets, otherwise it is 1 octetNone

node.name: attr-value
node.description: Raw attribute value data, not to exceed the length indicated in the attr-len field. The maximum length of the attribute data is 2^16-1 per the max value of the attr-len field (2 octets).None

node.name: last-modified-date
node.description: Timestamp of when this path was last changedNone

node.name: last-update-received
node.description: Timestamp of when the last BGP update message was received for this path / prefixNone

node.name: valid-route
node.description: Indicates that the route is considered valid by the local routerNone

node.name: invalid-reason
node.description: If the route is rejected as invalid, this indicates the reason.None

node.name: best-path
node.description: Current path was selected as the best path.None

node.name: oc-bgprib-ext:reject-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason the route is not used, either due to policy filtering or bestpath selectionNone

node.name: adj-rib-in-post
node.description: Per-neighbor table containing the paths received from the neighbor that are eligible for best-path selection after local input policy rules have been applied.None

node.name: num-routes
node.description: Number of route entries in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.name: prefix
node.description: Prefix for the routeNone

node.name: attributes
node.description: Base BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: origin
node.description: BGP attribute defining the origin of the path information.None

node.name: as-path
node.description:
String representation of the BGP AS path attribute as concatenated AS path segments. Each segment of the AS_PATH should be formatted as follows based on the segment type (#### denotes a single AS number):
AS_SEQ: #### #### ##### AS_SET: { #### #### } AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE: ( #### #### ) AS_CONFED_SET: [ #### #### ]
AS_PATH segment types are described in RFC 5065.
In the Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, this leaf should show the received or sent AS_PATH value, respectively. For example, if the local router is not 4-byte capable, this value should consist of 2-octet ASNs or the AS_TRANS (AS 23456) values received or sent in route updates.
In the Loc-RIB, this leaf should reflect the effective AS path for the route, e.g., a 4-octet value if the local router is 4-octet capable.None

node.name: as4-path
node.description: This string represents the AS path encoded with 4-octet AS numbers in the optional transitive AS4_PATH attribute. This value is populated with the received or sent attribute in Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, respectively. It should not be populated in Loc-RIB since the Loc-RIB is expected to store the effective AS-Path in the as-path leaf regardless of being 4-octet or 2-octet.None

node.name: next-hop
node.description: BGP next hop attribute defining the IP address of the router that should be used as the next hop to the destinationNone

node.name: med
node.description: BGP multi-exit discriminator attribute used in BGP route selection processNone

node.name: local-pref
node.description: BGP local preference attribute sent to internal peers to indicateNone

node.name: atomic-aggr
node.description: BGP attribute indicating that the prefix is an atomic aggregate, i.e., the peer selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route that is included in it.None

node.name: aggregator
node.description: BGP attribute indicating the prefix has been aggregated by the specified AS and router.None

node.name: as
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: as4
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation (4-octet representation). This value is populated if an upstream router is not 4-octet capable. Its semantics are similar to the AS4_PATH optional transitive attributeNone

node.name: address
node.description: IP address of the router that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: community
node.description: List of standard BGP community attributes.None

node.name: ext-attributes
node.description: Extended BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: originator-id
node.description: BGP attribute that provides the id as an IPv4 address of the route reflector that created the announcementNone

node.name: cluster-list
node.description: Represents the reflection path that the route has passed.None

node.name: ext-community
node.description: List of BGP extended community attributesNone

node.name: aigp
node.description: BGP path attribute representing the accumulated IGP metric for the pathNone

node.name: path-id
node.description: When the BGP speaker supports advertisement of multiple paths for a prefix, the path identifier is used to uniquely identify a route based on the combination of the prefix and path id. In the Adj-RIB-In, the path-id value is the value received in the update message. In the Loc-RIB, if used, it should represent a locally generated path-id value for the corresponding route. In Adj-RIB-Out, it should be the value sent to a neighbor when add-paths is used, i.e., the capability has been negotiated.None

node.name: unknown-attribute
node.description: This list contains received attributes that are unrecognized or unsupported by the local router. The list may be empty.None

node.name: attr-type
node.description: 2-octet value encoding the attribute flags and the attribute type codeNone

node.name: attr-len
node.description: One or two octet attribute length field indicating the length of the attribute data in octets. If the Extended Length attribute flag in the attribute type field is set, the length field is 2 octets, otherwise it is 1 octetNone

node.name: attr-value
node.description: Raw attribute value data, not to exceed the length indicated in the attr-len field. The maximum length of the attribute data is 2^16-1 per the max value of the attr-len field (2 octets).None

node.name: last-modified-date
node.description: Timestamp of when this path was last changedNone

node.name: last-update-received
node.description: Timestamp of when the last BGP update message was received for this path / prefixNone

node.name: valid-route
node.description: Indicates that the route is considered valid by the local routerNone

node.name: invalid-reason
node.description: If the route is rejected as invalid, this indicates the reason.None

node.name: best-path
node.description: Current path was selected as the best path.None

node.name: oc-bgprib-ext:reject-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason the route is not used, either due to policy filtering or bestpath selectionNone

node.name: neighbors
node.description: Enclosing container for neighbor listNone

node.name: neighbor
node.description: List of neighbors (peers) of the local BGP speakerNone

node.name: neighbor-address
node.description: IP address of the BGP neighbor or peerNone

node.name: adj-rib-in-pre
node.description: Per-neighbor table containing the NLRI updates received from the neighbor before any local input policy rules or filters have been applied. This can be considered the 'raw' updates from the neighbor.None

node.name: num-routes
node.description: Number of route entries in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.name: prefix
node.description: Prefix for the routeNone

node.name: attributes
node.description: Base BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: origin
node.description: BGP attribute defining the origin of the path information.None

node.name: as-path
node.description:
String representation of the BGP AS path attribute as concatenated AS path segments. Each segment of the AS_PATH should be formatted as follows based on the segment type (#### denotes a single AS number):
AS_SEQ: #### #### ##### AS_SET: { #### #### } AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE: ( #### #### ) AS_CONFED_SET: [ #### #### ]
AS_PATH segment types are described in RFC 5065.
In the Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, this leaf should show the received or sent AS_PATH value, respectively. For example, if the local router is not 4-byte capable, this value should consist of 2-octet ASNs or the AS_TRANS (AS 23456) values received or sent in route updates.
In the Loc-RIB, this leaf should reflect the effective AS path for the route, e.g., a 4-octet value if the local router is 4-octet capable.None

node.name: as4-path
node.description: This string represents the AS path encoded with 4-octet AS numbers in the optional transitive AS4_PATH attribute. This value is populated with the received or sent attribute in Adj-RIB-In or Adj-RIB-Out, respectively. It should not be populated in Loc-RIB since the Loc-RIB is expected to store the effective AS-Path in the as-path leaf regardless of being 4-octet or 2-octet.None

node.name: next-hop
node.description: BGP next hop attribute defining the IP address of the router that should be used as the next hop to the destinationNone

node.name: med
node.description: BGP multi-exit discriminator attribute used in BGP route selection processNone

node.name: local-pref
node.description: BGP local preference attribute sent to internal peers to indicateNone

node.description: BGP attribute indicating that the prefix is an atomic aggregate, i.e., the peer selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route that is included in it.None

node.name: aggregator
node.description: BGP attribute indicating the prefix has been aggregated by the specified AS and router.None

node.name: as
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: as4
node.description: AS number of the autnonomous system that performed the aggregation (4-octet representation). This value is populated if an upstream router is not 4-octet capable. Its semantics are similar to the AS4_PATH optional transitive attributeNone

node.name: address
node.description: IP address of the router that performed the aggregation.None

node.name: community
node.description: List of standard BGP community attributes.None

node.name: ext-attributes
node.description: Extended BGP route attributes associated with this routeNone

node.name: originator-id
node.description: BGP attribute that provides the id as an IPv4 address of the route reflector that created the announcementNone

node.name: cluster-list
node.description: Represents the reflection path that the route has passed.None

node.name: ext-community
node.description: List of BGP extended community attributesNone

node.name: aigp
node.description: BGP path attribute representing the accumulated IGP metric for the pathNone

node.name: path-id
node.description: When the BGP speaker supports advertisement of multiple paths for a prefix, the path identifier is used to uniquely identify a route based on the combination of the prefix and path id. In the Adj-RIB-In, the path-id value is the value received in the update message. In the Loc-RIB, if used, it should represent a locally generated path-id value for the corresponding route. In Adj-RIB-Out, it should be the value sent to a neighbor when add-paths is used, i.e., the capability has been negotiated.None

node.name: unknown-attribute
node.description: This list contains received attributes that are unrecognized or unsupported by the local router. The list may be empty.None

node.name: attr-type
node.description: 2-octet value encoding the attribute flags and the attribute type codeNone

node.name: attr-len
node.description: One or two octet attribute length field indicating the length of the attribute data in octets. If the Extended Length attribute flag in the attribute type field is set, the length field is 2 octets, otherwise it is 1 octetNone

node.name: attr-value
node.description: Raw attribute value data, not to exceed the length indicated in the attr-len field. The maximum length of the attribute data is 2^16-1 per the max value of the attr-len field (2 octets).None

node.name: last-modified-date
node.description: Timestamp of when this path was last changedNone

node.name: last-update-received
node.description: Timestamp of when the last BGP update message was received for this path / prefixNone

node.name: valid-route
node.description: Indicates that the route is considered valid by the local routerNone

node.name: invalid-reason
node.description: If the route is rejected as invalid, this indicates the reason.None

node.name: best-path
node.description: Current path was selected as the best path.None

node.name: oc-bgprib-ext:reject-reason
node.description: Indicates the reason the route is not used, either due to policy filtering or bestpath selectionNone

node.name: adj-rib-in-post
node.description: Per-neighbor table containing the paths received from the neighbor that are eligible for best-path selection after local input policy rules have been applied.None

node.name: num-routes
node.description: Number of route entries in the tableNone

node.name: routes
node.description: Enclosing container for list of routes in the routing table.None

node.name: route
node.description: List of routes in the tableNone

node.description: Prefix for the routeNone
